intro: Croton catamarcensis, commonly known as the Catamarcensis croton, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the Andean region of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful leaves that often display vibrant red, orange, and yellow hues. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
